content:
Add Custom Fields to Article Types

Create custom fields to store information thatâ€™s important to your articles. The only standard fields provided on article types are: Article Number, Summary, Title, and URL Name. At minimum, you want to create a field where authors can write the body of the article.

Available in: Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience (not available in all orgs)

Required editions:
- Unlimited Edition with Service Cloud
- Professional, Enterprise, Performance, and Developer Editions for an additional cost

User permissions needed:
- Customize Application
- Manage Salesforce Knowledge

Before you begin, determine the type of custom field you want to create.

From Setup, enter Knowledge Article Types in the Quick Find box, then select Knowledge Article Types.
Select an article type.
Click New in the Fields related list.
Choose the type of field to create, and click Next.
Enter a field label. The field name is automatically populated based on the field label you enter.
Set the field-level security to determine whether the field is visible and editable or read only for specific profiles, and click Next.
Select the Dynamic Forms-enabled Lightning record pages that should include the field, then click Next.
Click Save to finish or Save & New to create more custom fields.

Optionally rearrange your custom fields on the article-type layout.
title: Adding Custom Fields to Salesforce Knowledge
